intro: Porroglossum panguiensis, commonly known as the Guianese sunflower, is a herbaceous plant native to South America, particularly found in Guyana and Venezuela. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features alternate, lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces yellow-orange ray florets surrounded by tubular disk florets. Porroglossum panguiensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests, where it thrives in the understory vegetation. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential herbal applications.
